text: Oh no! I'm so sorry Shane! I did what you did in the beginning and didn't get the notification! Really sorry!

Okay so to answer your questions, waaay to late I'm afraid. 
Keying is really hard since it varies so much from shot to shot. My favourite is and ibk base and then keylight for hair and stuff. I wish there was just one track for it, but different cameras, lighting, screens etc makes every shot so different. But I rely pretty heavily on additive keyers, they can save you quite a bit when it comes to motion blur as well. As well as always trying to bring back the original grain when you can, theres usually a lot of detail in that and will help you sell it.
